      void updateTicket(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
      Save a ticket, used to redeem tickets or add tickets to the system

      Sample Params:
      deviceId=thangle-device&gameType=BOOPY&ticketObjectType =PROFILE&purchaseCode =myboopytestsubscription3&receiptToken=XXXXXXXXXXX &purchaseProvider=GOOGLE

      Things to keep in mind:
      1) When passing in a receipt token, a purchase provider is required!

      2) You can now purchase an item using the ticketObjectType/purchaseCode params or the ticketObjectType/objectId params.
      Either way you need to always send in the ticketObjectType, and either the purchaseCode or the objectId.

      3) Difference between receiptToken and receiptData:
      receiptToken is a unique identifier that can be use to quickly determine whether a purchase has already been processed or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getPurchaseList

        public void getPurchaseList(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<PurchaseItemListResponse> callback)
        Get a list of purchasable items from the system. This is list if filtered by the game type and the purchase type list.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/list

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseTypes
          a list of Enums.PurchaseType
        • SirqulKeys.serviceActions
          a list of Enums.ServiceAction

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a PurchaseItemListResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        TicketApiBase.getPurchaseList

      • updateTicket

        public void updateTicket(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Save a ticket, used to redeem tickets or add tickets to the system

        Sample Params:
        deviceId=thangle-device&gameType=BOOPY&ticketObjectType =PROFILE&purchaseCode =myboopytestsubscription3&receiptToken=XXXXXXXXXXX &purchaseProvider=GOOGLE

        Things to keep in mind:
        1) When passing in a receipt token, a purchase provider is required!

        2) You can now purchase an item using the ticketObjectType/purchaseCode params or the ticketObjectType/objectId params.
        Either way you need to always send in the ticketObjectType, and either the purchaseCode or the objectId.

        3) Difference between receiptToken and receiptData:
        receiptToken is a unique identifier that can be use to quickly determine whether a purchase has already been processed or not.
        receiptData is a blob of text that is necessary for validating a purchase via iTunes/Gooogle/etc.
        For example, a receiptToken might be a transaction id, while the receiptData might be a Json object containing a signature, purchase-info, etc.

        Target API Endpoint: /ticket/save

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key for what's currently being played. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.actionType
          the action being performed. Enums.TicketActionType
        • SirqulKeys.ticketObjectType
          the type of object being purchased. Enums.TicketObjectType
        • SirqulKeys.objectId
          the ID of the item being purchased.
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
          the purchase code
        • SirqulKeys.receiptToken
          the receipt token
        • SirqulKeys.receiptData
          the receipt data
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseProvider
          the purchase provider
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseTypes
          a list of purchase types Enums.PurchaseType
        • SirqulKeys.returnProfileResponse
          the return profile response
        • SirqulKeys.includeProfileResponse
          the include profile response
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          the version of the application. AppVersion

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        Returns type AppResponse if returnProfileResponse is false, returns type ProfileResponse if true.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        TicketApiBase.updateTicket

      • updateTicketWithFileUpload

        public void updateTicketWithFileUpload(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Update ticket with file upload. Similar to updateTicket, but takes a file path for receiptData to upload. If no file is supplied, this will revert to updateTicket with a null receiptData. Returns type AppResponse if returnProfileResponse is false, else returns type ProfileResponse if true.

        Target API Endpoint: /ticket/save/fileUpload or /ticket/save if no file, or error reading file.

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key. Maps to "gameType".
        • SirqulKeys.actionType
          the action type
        • SirqulKeys.ticketObjectType
          the ticket object type
        • SirqulKeys.objectId
          the object id
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
          the purchase code
        • SirqulKeys.receiptToken
          the receipt token
        • SirqulKeys.receiptDataFilePath
          the receipt data file path
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseProvider
          the purchase provider
        • SirqulKeys.purchaseTypes
          the purchase types
        • SirqulKeys.returnProfileResponse
          If true, type ProfileResponse is returned, else type AppResponse is returned.
        • SirqulKeys.includeProfileResponse
          If returnProfileResponse is equal to false and you're expecting a AppResponse in return, setting this to true will include ProfileResponse within the returned AppResponse object.
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          the application version, AppVersion

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        TicketApiBase.updateTicketWithFileUpload
